name: Classic Masala Dosa
description: Crispy South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, filled with spiced potato curry.
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When they splutter, add curry leaves and green chilies.
2. Add sliced onions and sauté until translucent.
3. Add turmeric powder and boiled potatoes. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
4. Season with salt and garnish with coriander. Set aside.
5. Heat a non-stick pan or dosa tawa. Pour a ladle of batter and spread it thin in a circular motion.
6. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until golden and crispy.
7. Place the potato filling in the center and fold the dosa.
8. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Idli Sambar
description: Soft and fluffy steamed rice cakes served with flavorful lentil curry, a staple South Indian breakfast.
instructions:
1. Steam idli batter in idli plates for 10-12 minutes until fluffy.
2. Cook toor dal with turmeric until soft and mushy.
3. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
4. Add onions and tomatoes, cook until soft.
5. Add sambar powder, cooked dal, and tamarind paste.
6. Simmer for 10 minutes, add salt to taste.
7. Serve hot idlis with sambar and coconut chutney.

name: Medu Vada
description: Crispy donut-shaped fritters made from black gram dal, a popular South Indian snack.
instructions:
1. Soak urad dal for 4 hours, then grind to a fluffy paste with minimal water.
2. Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, cumin seeds, and salt.
3. Mix well and beat for 2-3 minutes to make it fluffy.
4. Heat oil for deep frying.
5. Wet hands, take a portion of batter, make a hole in center and slide into oil.
6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.
7. Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

name: Coconut Rice (Thengai Sadam)
description: Fragrant South Indian rice dish mixed with fresh coconut, curry leaves, and spices.
instructions:
1. Heat coconut oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
2. When they splutter, add red chilies, curry leaves, peanuts, and cashews.
3. Fry until cashews turn golden.
4. Add grated coconut and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add cooked rice and salt, mix gently.
6. Cook for 3-4 minutes until well combined.
7. Serve warm with pickle or papad.

name: Chettinad Chicken Curry
description: Spicy and aromatic chicken curry from Tamil Nadu with a rich blend of roasted spices.
instructions:
1. Heat coconut oil, sauté onions until golden.
2. Add ginger-garlic paste and curry leaves.
3. Add chicken pieces and cook until 70% done.
4. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
5. Add chettinad masala powder and cook for 2 minutes.
6. Pour coconut milk and simmer for 15 minutes.
7. Season with salt and garnish with curry leaves.
8. Serve with rice or appam.

name: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
description: Creamy and rich North Indian chicken curry in a tomato-based sauce with butter and cream.
instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt.
2. Cook chicken in a pan until done, set aside.
3. In the same pan, add butter and chopped tomatoes.
4. Cook until tomatoes break down and form a thick sauce.
5. Add cooked chicken and garam masala.
6. Pour in heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander.
8. Serve hot with naan or basmati rice.

name: Dal Makhani
description: Rich and creamy North Indian black lentil curry slow-cooked with butter and cream.
instructions:
1. Soak urad dal and rajma overnight, then pressure cook until soft.
2. Heat butter in a heavy-bottomed pan, add cumin seeds.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
4. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
5. Add cooked dal and beans, simmer for 45 minutes.
6. Add garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
7. Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 10 more minutes.
8. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chole Bhature
description: Spicy chickpea curry served with fluffy fried bread, a popular North Indian street food.
instructions:
1. Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until soft.
2. For bhature: Mix flour, yogurt, baking powder, and salt. Knead into soft dough.
3. Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
5. Add chole masala and cooked chickpeas.
6. Simmer for 20 minutes until thick.
7. Roll bhature and deep fry until puffed.
8. Serve hot chole with fresh bhature.

name: Aloo Gobi
description: Classic North Indian dry curry with potatoes and cauliflower spiced with turmeric and cumin.
instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds.
2. Add onions and sauté until golden.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
4. Add turmeric, coriander powder, and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Add potatoes and cauliflower, mix well.
6. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
7. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
8. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
description: Creamy North Indian curry with soft paneer cubes in a rich tomato and butter sauce.
instructions:
1. Heat butter in a pan, lightly fry paneer cubes and set aside.
2. In the same pan, add ginger-garlic paste.
3. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
4. Add red chili powder, garam masala, sugar, and salt.
5. Add fried paneer cubes and mix gently.
6. Pour in heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander.
8. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Biryani Hyderabadi
description: Aromatic and flavorful rice dish with layers of spiced meat and fragrant basmati rice.
instructions:
1. Marinate mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt for 2 hours.
2. Cook marinated mutton until 70% done.
3. Boil rice with whole spices until 70% cooked, drain.
4. Layer cooked mutton in a heavy-bottomed pot.
5. Top with rice, fried onions, mint, coriander, and saffron milk.
6. Cover with aluminum foil, then lid, and cook on high heat for 3 minutes.
7. Reduce heat and cook for 45 minutes.
8. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.
9. Serve with raita and shorba.

name: Rajma Chawal
description: Comfort food from North India - kidney bean curry served with steamed rice.
instructions:
1. Pressure cook soaked rajma until soft and mushy.
2. Cook basmati rice separately and keep warm.
3. Heat oil, add cumin seeds.
4. Add onions and cook until golden.
5. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
6. Cook until tomatoes break down.
7. Add spices and cooked rajma with its liquid.
8. Simmer for 20 minutes until thick.
9. Serve hot rajma over steamed rice.

name: Masala Chai
description: Traditional Indian spiced tea with a perfect blend of aromatic spices, milk, and tea leaves.
instructions:
1. Boil water with all whole spices and ginger.
2. Add tea leaves and boil for 2 minutes.
3. Add milk and bring to a boil.
4. Simmer for 3-4 minutes until the tea becomes aromatic.
5. Add sugar to taste.
6. Strain and serve hot in small cups.
7. Enjoy with biscuits or snacks.

name: Poha (Flattened Rice)
description: Light and nutritious Maharashtra breakfast dish made with flattened rice, vegetables, and spices.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and lemon juice for garnish
instructions:
1. Rinse poha gently and drain, sprinkle turmeric and salt.
2. Heat oil, add mustard seeds and peanuts.
3. When mustard seeds splutter, add curry leaves and green chilies.
4. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
5. Add the seasoned poha and sugar.
6. Mix gently and cook for 3-4 minutes.
7. Garnish with coriander and serve with lemon juice.
8. Enjoy hot as breakfast or evening snack.

name: Tandoori Chicken
description: Smoky and flavorful North Indian chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, traditionally cooked in a tandoor.
ingredients: Onion slices and mint for garnish
instructions:
1. Make deep cuts in chicken pieces and wash thoroughly.
2. Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, all spices, lemon juice, oil, and salt.
3. Marinate chicken in this mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
4. Preheat oven to 200°C or prepare grill.
5. Cook chicken for 25-30 minutes, turning once.
6. Baste with oil or butter halfway through.
7. Cook until chicken is charred and cooked through.
8. Garnish with onion slices and mint.
9. Serve hot with naan and mint chutney.
